ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I will recommend. This course provides a good knowledge of the Arctic climate and ocean change, crutial for a graduate student.

G&G 742 01 is a concise and self-contained introduction to the study of physical processes at play in the Arctic. I would definitely recommend the course to a fellow student interested in the physics of Arctic climate.

I would recommend this course for a fellow student. This course might be a natural follow-on courses in G&G after taking GFD, Physical Oceanography and Physics of Weather and Climate. So students may implement this knowledge during class discussions. It is also a good preparation for a qualification exam.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: From the papers we discussed, I got a better and more comprehensive view of the Arctic Ocean, which is important to the width of my research.
A lot. All class discussions were basically about my research.
